title: IT-specialist/Systemadministratör SCADA system
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Services for Renewable Energy, and Engineering Services
description:
**IT-specialist/Systemadministratör SCADA system** 




 Med människor i fokus och rötter i traditionell automation är vi en av Sveriges ledande leverantörer av resurseffektiviserande system för energi, infra och industri. Vi tar ett helhetsansvar för både stora och mindre projekt med el, kraft och automation. Vi levererar även hela anläggningar där vi utöver våra automationslösningar tar ett totalansvar - människor, montagelösningar och mekanik. Genom att kombinera projektförmåga, branschkunnande och teknisk kompetens, skapar vi framgång och utveckling för både medarbetare och kunder. Våra resurser har vi samlade i eget hus vilket ger oss en värdefull samverkan och kontinuitet i projekten. För oss handlar projektförmåga om att skapa konkurrenskraft åt och tillsammans med våra kunder. Överallt där industriproduktion effektiviseras och utvecklas har Granitor Systems en naturlig och viktig roll att spela.
 



  





 Vår kund behöver nu förstärka sin linjeorganisation med en IT-specialister/systemadministratörer i en förvaltningsorganisation som har nära samarbete med verksamheten med ansvar att förvalta av vårt nuvarande SCADA/EMS-system.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifterna ingår:** 



* Leda felsökning vid incidenter samt agera support och stöd till andra system, Kundens verksamhet samt externa parter.
* Utveckling och kodning av applikationsmodulerna utförs av leverantören, men man behöver kunna skriva skript och hantera manuella SQL-databasoperationer i syfte att bistå i manuell driftsättning, testning och felsökning
* Det ingår också att löpande säkerställa att tekniska förändringar i applikationen inte påverkar driftsäkerhet, IT-säkerhet och befintliga funktioner
* I rollen ingår att säkra leverans och drift av SCADA/EMS-system inklusive underhåll och övervakning. Man kommer också delta i arbete med uppgraderingar och systemförbättringar.
* Tillsammans med teamet bidrar man även till att kontinuerligt utveckla det egna teamets aktiviteter och processer



  





**Beredskap:** 




 Beredskap kan komma att innebära att man kommer att ingå i beredskapruppering och har då beredskap under en vecka, normalt torsdag till torsdag. Hur ofta detta sker är beroende av antal personer i teamet, vanligtvis var sjätte till åttonde vecka.
 



  





**Vem söker vi:** 



* Universitets- eller högskoleutbildning med inriktning mot IT alternativt civilingenjör.



  





**Kompetens och Erfarenhet:** 



* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med komplexa IT-miljöer baserade på Linux/Unix.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med verksamhetskritiska eller driftkritiska IT-system (t.ex. styrning och övervakning i realtid).
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete med applikations- och systemadministration.
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet från energibranschen.
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete inom säkerhetskänslig verksamhet.
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete inom myndighet eller annan offentlig verksamhet



  





**Bra att veta:** 



* Placering: Sundbyberg
* Omfattning: heltidstjänst
* Säkerhetsprövning: Säkerhetsprövning av kandidaten kan komma att krävas!
* Tjänsteresor förekommer



  





**Kontaktperson:** 




 Siamak Hashemi (Gruppchef), siamak.hashemi@granitor.se
 



  





**Rekryteringsprocessen:** 



* Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så sök nu!
* Vi önskar vänligen men bestämt att inte bli kontaktade av säljare.

title: IT-tekniker Service Desk
description:
*Bankgirot söker nu en IT-tekniker till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att vidareutveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som uppfyller både internationella standarder och regelverk.* 




  





*Parallellt säkerställer vi att dagens drift- och supportfunktioner fungerar säkert, effektivt och i enlighet med gällande krav – varje dag. Arbetet med att bygga upp ett nytt Operations Center är i full gång, och vi söker dig som vill vara med i resan. Som IT-tekniker inom vår nyetablerade Service Desk kommer du spela en nyckelroll i att ge användarsupport på plats och samtidigt bidra till att forma vår framtida supportfunktion – på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och för varandra.* 




  





**Din roll** 




 I rollen som IT-tekniker arbetar du nära användarna i organisationen med att lösa tekniska problem och ge support på plats. Samtidigt kliver du in i en unik fas – där vi tillsammans bygger upp en ny supportverksamhet från grunden. Du får vara med och utforma verktyg, rutiner och arbetssätt, testa nya lösningar och bidra med dina idéer kring hur vi bäst skapar en modern och effektiv IT-support. Rollen är praktisk och varierad och passar dig som vill kombinera tekniskt kunnande med god service och samarbete i ett team. Du arbetar kontorstider (08:00–17:00) och är placerad på Bankgirots kontor i Liljeholmen. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter innefattar:
 



  




* Ge användarsupport på plats och hantera incidenter och service requests kopplade till klientmiljö och IT-utrustning.
* Utföra installation, felsökning och konfigurering av datorer, nätverksutrustning och mobila enheter.
* Samarbeta med andra IT-team och eskalera komplexa ärenden vid behov samt dokumentera enligt gällande processer.
* Delta i etableringen av Operations Center genom test av verktyg, utveckling av rutiner och förbättring av arbetssätt.



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 




 Du har ett stort intresse för IT och erfarenhet av arbete inom teknisk support, service desk eller onsite-support. Du har god förståelse för Windowsmiljöer och klienthantering, och är van vid att arbeta med ärendehanteringssystem samt enligt ITIL-processer. Du har kunskap om Active Directory och Microsoft 365, och det är meriterande om du även har grundläggande erfarenhet av PowerShell.
 



  





 Du är en serviceinriktad person med god förmåga att kommunicera med användare på olika tekniska nivåer. Du är strukturerad och lösningsorienterad, trivs med att arbeta självständigt och drivs av att ta ansvar för dina ärenden. Eftersom rollen är en del av ett pågående uppbyggnadsarbete är det viktigt att du är flexibel, initiativtagande och motiveras av att vara med och forma nya arbetssätt och rutiner tillsammans med kollegor.
 



  





**Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner** 




 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
 



 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
 



  





 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
 



  





**Intresserad?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230.
 



  





 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Om Bankgirot** 




 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
 



  





 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
 



  





 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Product Coordinator at H&M Studios
description:
**Job Description**
 As a  Product Coordinator  you are responsible for coordinating and administrating all product samples in the studio, making sure products are shot according to trends and timeline.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include:
   

  

* Unpack, register, label, sort incoming products
* Organize and keep the wardrobe up to date (re-organize, clear out garments/accessories etc).
* Prepare and secure product samples for scheduled shoots, ensuring readiness and accuracy.
* Create detailed set lists in our system to guide shoot execution and styling.
* Manage post-shoot sample handling, including returns, storage, and documentation.
* Close dialogue and collaboration with the Production manager and Stylist to secure planning.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You work closely with all teams in the studio and the assortment teams making sure products are shot according to trends and timeline.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
 We are looking for people with:
   

  

* Experience in a high-paced work environment.
* An open-minded, flexible and strong communication skill.
* Previous work experience in a store is meritorious.


 And people who are:
   

  

* Highly structured and organized, capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Independent workers with a high level of ownership and responsibility.
* Team players who appreciate and contribute to good teamwork.
* Taking initiatives and enjoying the opportunity to develop and improve things.
* Interested in fashion, materials, and production.


**Additional Information**
 This is a  full time permanent position based at H&M Studios in Stockholm, starting as soon as possible. Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than
 **18th August 2025.** 
 Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
  

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.
* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. (Example: Competitive compensation for your dedication and long-term commitment. A day off on your birthday to relax and celebrate your special day. Special gift to celebrate the birth of your child, etc.)


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application

title: Google Workspace Specialist
description:
**Company Description**
 We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.
   

  

 With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.
   

  

 Curious about our projects? We got you:
 *Check out our success stories*
**Job Description**
 As a Google Workspace Specialist, you will work within the Google Workspace Service Delivery team to help our customers with their support needs. You will be responsible for becoming a trusted advisor for all things Google Workspace for our customer base. In this role, you will leverage your deep understanding of Google Workspace to drive successful customer outcomes.
   

  

 You will be involved in customer projects both technical and change management focused and will help to perform migrations to Google Workspace. You will provide onboarding, training and best practice guidance on how to use the tools at their disposal, accommodating different levels of customers’ technical expertise. In order to assure their satisfaction you will resolve arising technical issues, either by yourself or in cooperation with our team of experts. You will be working with many varied customers from scale ups, retail, technology, gaming and entertainment, to the public sector. Regular customer touchpoints will allow you to maintain a solid overview on the customer status and identify possible business development opportunities.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Execute the technical aspects of Google Workspace implementation projects, including migrations, integrations, and custom configurations.
* Provide technical troubleshooting and problem resolution for complex Google Workspace issues.
* Analyze customer environments to recommend and implement optimal Google Workspace configurations and best practices.
* Provide onboarding and training to customers
* Collaborate with internal teams and external stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery and customer satisfaction.
* Stay abreast of the latest Google Workspace features, updates, and technical advancements.
* Identify opportunities for technical improvements and strategic evolution within customer Google Workspace environments.


 Qualifications
   

  

* Good knowledge of Google Workspace solutions, preferably confirmed by certification.
* Experience with managing Microsoft 365 and similar solutions is a big bonus!
* Excellent communication and presentation skills befitting a customer-facing role.
* Ability to provide high-quality customer onboarding and training.
* Ability to communicate and explain complex technical concepts to varied audiences.
* Previous experience with IT network or systems administration.
* Previous experience in support and/or service desk role.
* Fluent English is required; proficiency in one of the Scandinavian languages is preferred.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?**
* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
* End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.


 We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them:
 *follow us on LinkedIn*
**Benefits**
* Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
* Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
* A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
* An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
* A human-centric and value-based company culture.
* Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
* A modern office in central Stockholm.
* Full provision of work tools.
* A variety of social events.


 Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.
   

  

 Want to know more about life at Devoteam?
 *Check our Instagram page*
 Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities!
 *Check out our Career page*

title: (Associate) Microsoft Systems Technical Service Manager – based in Luxembourg
description:
***This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.*
 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Information Systems Directorate (GIS), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Infrastructure Services Division (IS), UC & Windows Client Services Unit (UCWS) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) Microsoft Systems Technical Service Manager\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Associate) Engineer IT Tech & Infra


*Panel interviews are foreseen as from September 2025.*
 Purpose
   

  

 You will manage the technology roadmap, design, and delivery of projects, as well as the daily operations for Windows Operating System Servers. Your role will be key in aligning technology solutions with the organisation's needs and contributing directly to the achievement of the EIB's strategic objectives
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 As a Microsoft Servers Systems Technical Service Manager, you will be part of the UC & Windows Client Services Unit within Infrastructure Services Division. You will be responsible for providing senior technical expertise and leadership in support for Windows Operating Systems.
   

  

 The successful candidate will report to the Head of UC & Windows Client Services Unit
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Deliver projects and manage the Windows Servers daily operations with the support of a team of consultants and / or a managed services provider
* Create, maintain a technology roadmap for Windows Operating Systems Servers in a context of fast automation and digitalisation of EIB activities
* Maintain Windows Services, address vulnerabilities in collaboration with IT Security Unit, manage patching campaigns and upgrades to ensure compliance
* Assess impact of releases, features or changes on the IT environment and advise relevant stakeholders on a recommended approach
* Work closely with development, engineering, support, infrastructure, and business operations teams to drive problems and incident resolution
* Provide risk mitigation measures, maintain systems compliance and address audit findings
* Contribute to the execution of Windows Services disaster recovery, business continuity requirements and capacity plans
* Actively propose ideas of improvement and optimisation for the existing processes and services and then track their development and implementation
* Ensure that projects and processes are managed properly and that solutions are designed and implemented in line with internal policies, procedures and that best practice, security recommendations and industry standards are respected
* Provide advice, in consultation with various IT teams in the context of projects and act as a change owner to introduce innovative approaches within the Bank’s IT solutions


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related disciplines
* Minimum 3 years of professional experience in Windows system administration, including troubleshooting, performance optimization, and implementing new solutions.
* Experience with tools such as MECM, Intune, SCOM, and Active Directory / Entra ID (including Group Policy management).
* Experience contributing to IT infrastructure projects or upgrades, ideally involving new technology rollouts.
* Experience with PowerShell scripting skills for automation and system administration tasks.
* Understanding of IT security practices, such as patching, secure builds, and vulnerability remediation.
* Understanding of networking fundamentals (e.g., TCP/IP, VPN); exposure to F5, Single Sign-On, or Splunk is an advantage.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS and/or automation tools like Azure DevOps is a plus.
* Exposure to Linux environments or mixed OS ecosystems is an advantage but not mandatory.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Technical Support Representative
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to make it happen. You’ll solve challenges, deliver solutions and develop new, efficient processes that make a direct impact on our customers’ lives.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a
 **Technical Support Representative** 
 , you will join our multilingual Technical Support team are the product experts to whom users, professionals and partners turn to when in need of help.
   

  

 In this experience, you will be the voice of Tobii Dynavox to our users and partners in the North region and deliver high-quality technical support, while gaining in-depth knowledge of our diverse portfolio of products.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 This is a full-time, permanent and
 **onsite** 
 role at our office in Stockholm city.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Technical Support & Issue Resolution
* Assist customers, partners, and internal colleagues with any technical inquiries and supporting requests about our products. Build understanding of product features, functionalities and best practices, empowering them to resolve issues independently.
* Troubleshoot issues across our hardware and software platforms via phone, email, chat and remote desktop sessions, collaborating with developers and other stakeholders when necessary.
* Nurture and maintain strong customer relationships by demonstrating empathy, patience, and commitment to their success, whatever that looks like for them.
* Collaborate with our marketing team to monitor our social media channels.
* Documentation & Knowledge Sharing
* Assist in the development and maintenance of technical documentation such as articles, FAQs, and user guides tailored for target regions.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone that has:
   

  

* At least 1 year of experience in working with customer service, technical or product support roles with a great understanding of Windows / iOS environment
* Previous experience in solving technical issues while maintaining high customer satisfaction.
* Communication skills to interact with the tech-savvy people while making computer novices feel supported and understood.
* Proficiency in written and spoken English is required. Proficiency in Swedish and/or Norwegian is considered as a great asset.
* Familiarity with Microsoft Office tools, CRM and ERP systems preferably Salesforce and Microsoft Dynamics.


**Apply today!**
 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Data & Analytics Specialist (London/Stockholm)
description:
Now Hiring: Data & Analytics Specialist to Drive Growth at Petbuddy Group
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden or London, UK |
 **Company:** 
 Petbuddy Group AB
 



  





 Petbuddy Group, a rapidly expanding, M&A-driven leader in the premium pet food market, needs a highly motivated, commercially-minded
 **Data & Analytics Specialist** 
 . This isn't just a role; it's a unique opportunity for a hands-on professional to
 **build our data and analytics function from the ground up** 
 , fundamentally shaping how we leverage data to drive business success.
 



  





 Our data landscape is a
 **true greenfield project** 
 —diverse entities, disparate systems, no centralized database. We critically need a self-starter to bring structure, insight, and efficiency. You'll be the
 **architect of our data future** 
 , creating systems and processes to enable faster, smarter decisions and reveal what truly drives our business forward.
 



  





 This position is ideal for an ambitious and startup-minded individual with
 **2-4 years of relevant experience** 
 , preferably within FMCG/retail, who thrives on
 **full ownership** 
 and making a tangible impact. If you love a challenge and want to see the direct results of your work, this is for you. You'll be the
 **go-to person for all things data** 
 , collaborating across every department to transform our capabilities.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 


* **Drive Business Impact:** 
 Analyze complex datasets to identify actionable opportunities for operational improvement, cost reduction, and revenue growth.
* **Own the Entire Data Lifecycle:** 
 Take charge of the full data pipeline, from raw data extraction to building a centralized data warehouse. This includes
 **designing and building critical data models, such as product data models.**
* **Deliver Sharp Insights:** 
 Conduct ad-hoc analysis, develop financial and operational models for M&A, and design/build self-service dashboards in Power BI. Your insights will directly inform strategic decisions.
* **Champion a Data-Driven Culture:** 
 Advocate for data literacy, training stakeholders on effective data use. Partner with commercial, finance, marketing, and senior management to provide data-led solutions.
* **Define & Integrate Data Systems:** 
 Define future data structures, select technologies, and ensure data integrity. Be a
 **key player in implementing new systems** 
 , ensuring seamless data flow. You'll also explore and implement
 **automation and AI solutions** 
 to streamline processes and enhance analytical capabilities.



  





 The Ideal Candidate:
 


* **Commercially Astute:** 
 You think like a business owner, relentlessly connecting data back to commercial outcomes.
* **Highly Driven & Autonomous:** 
 A self-starter who excels with a blank slate and minimal hand-holding. Proactive, resourceful, and eager to dive deep.
* **Technically Proficient & Practical:** 
 Strong hands-on skills in
 **SQL** 
 ,
 **Advanced Excel** 
 , and
 **Power BI** 
 (or similar). Python/R a plus; practical application is key.
* **Automation & AI Enthusiast:** 
 Experience or knowledge in leveraging
 **AI and automation tools (e.g., n8n)** 
 to optimize workflows and generate smarter insights is a significant advantage.
* **Exceptional Communicator:** 
 Translates complex data into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders and leadership.
* **Collaborative Partner:** 
 Skilled at building relationships and managing expectations across diverse teams.
* Located in or willing to relocate to Stockholm or London.



  





 A Unique Opportunity to Accelerate Your Career:
 



 This position offers a rare chance to
 **build a critical business function from the ground up** 
 within a high-growth company. As Petbuddy Group continues its M&A-driven expansion, your direct contributions will be pivotal in shaping the future success and scalability of the entire organization. We're committed to your professional development in a dynamic, supportive, and ambitious environment where your work truly makes a difference.
 



 If you're ready to make a tangible impact, thrive on challenges, and accelerate your career in a hands-on role, we encourage you to apply via LinkedIn.

title: Google Workspace Technical Lead
description:
**Company Description**
  

 We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.
   

  

 With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.
   

  

 Curious about our projects? We got you: 
 *Check out our success stories*
  

  

**Job Description**
  

 Are you a visionary and highly skilled Google Workspace expert looking to make a profound impact as a technical leader? Join our Google Workspace Delivery team as a Technical Lead and become the ultimate authority and strategic advisor for our most complex and high-profile customer engagements across the Nordics.
   

  

 In this pivotal role, you will leverage your deep understanding of Google Workspace to drive successful enterprise-level customer outcomes. You will be instrumental in leading the technical execution of Google Workspace transformation engagements, ensuring seamless migrations, and providing expert-level guidance on intricate technical deployments, custom configurations, and strategic integrations. You will mentor less experienced team members and act as a thought leader in the Google Workspace ecosystem.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

* Serve as the trusted technical principal advisor for all Google Workspace matters for our most strategic customers.
* Lead the technical execution of large-scale Google Workspace implementation projects, including complex migrations, advanced integrations, and bespoke custom configurations.
* Provide advanced technical troubleshooting, problem resolution, and root cause analysis for the most challenging issues.
* Proactively analyze complex customer environments to recommend, design, and implement optimal Google Workspace configurations, security postures, and best practices at an enterprise level.
* Collaborate with internal teams, Google product teams, and external stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery, drive innovation, and guarantee unparalleled customer satisfaction.
* Stay at the absolute forefront of the latest Google Workspace features, updates, technical advancements, and emerging trends, acting as an internal subject matter expert.
* Engage with a diverse range of clients across various industries (e.g., scale-ups, retail, technology, gaming, entertainment, public sector) to understand their complex technical needs and strategic challenges.
* Identify, champion, and drive opportunities for technical improvements and strategic evolution within customer Google Workspace environments, influencing long-term technology roadmaps.
* Mentor and provide technical guidance to other Google Workspace specialists and consultants, fostering a culture of continuous learning and excellence.
* Contribute to the development of best practices, methodologies, and technical collateral for Google Workspace deployments.


  

  

**Qualifications**
* Exceptional knowledge and extensive hands-on experience with Google Workspace solutions, confirmed by relevant Google Cloud certifications (e.g., Google Workspace Administrator, Google Cloud Architect, etc).
* Proven experience leading complex technical projects (eg. Microsoft to Google migrations) and managing hybrid environments is a significant advantage.
* Superior communication, presentation, and client-facing consulting skills, capable of influencing executive-level stakeholders and explaining highly complex technical concepts to varied audiences.
* Extensive previous experience with IT network or enterprise systems administration, with a strong understanding of identity management, security, and networking principles relevant to cloud environments.
* Previous roles may have included Solutions Engineer / Architect, Senior Deployment Specialist, Systems Administrator, etc
* Fluent English is required; proficiency in one of the Scandinavian languages is highly preferred.


  

  

**Additional Information**
  

**Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?**
* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront  of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.

* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.

title: Development Intern
description:
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a
 **part-time student worker** 
 to join our team (
 **1 – 2 day(s)/week** 
 ) and work with modelling hydro power river sections.
   

  

 In more detail, the following will be part of your areas of responsibilities:
   

  

  

* Develop and maintain Python-based models to simulate hydropower generation across river systems and cascaded hydro plants.
* Work with large datasets, including hydrological data, plant technical parameters, and operational histories.
* Collaborate with hydropower experts and analysts to refine model assumptions and ensure technical accuracy.
* Document code and workflows to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing within the team.
* Contribute to strategic studies and innovation projects related to hydro flexibility, climate adaptation, or hybrid operations.


**About You**
 To succeed in this role, we see that you bring the following background:
   

  

  

* You are currently pursuing a degree in engineering, applied mathematics, computer science, renewable energy, or a related field. Preferably first or second year master student.
* You are comfortable in developing and maintaining Python-based optimization models.
* Great understanding of data modelling methodologies and optimization.
* You enjoy problem-solving and are curious about how complex systems like river-based hydropower can be modelled and optimized.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, preferable also Swedish.
* You are a team player who is confident to take responsibility for your own tasks.


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application latest by 24th of August 2025. Applications will be evaluated continuously from the 11th of August. Please note that this is initially a six month employment. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Lovisa Torfgård, lovisa.torfgard@fortum.com or Karar Al Obeid, karar.al.obeid@fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page.**
**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Customer Support Specialist - Sweden
description:
*We're at a pivotal moment for both Tibber and the planet. When joining Tibber, you won’t just help scale a forward-thinking tech company – you’ll contribute to a real shift in how people consume electricity. With millions of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique energy trading portfolios on the market.*
*We’re looking for a Customer Support Specialist to join us in making the energy transition happen – maybe that’s you?*
**🚀🚀Job Mission**
 Do you get positive energy from providing service and advice in sustainability? Do you thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment and have little problem with change? Then we would very much like to get to know you better. Because we are looking for a Customer Support Specialist. As a Customer Support Specialist at Tibber, you will play a central role in providing exceptional service and support to our customers while contributing to our mission to revolutionise the energy industry. Some of your key responsibilities include;
   

  

**About The Role**
* Engagement: Building strong and lasting relationships with Tibber customers by delivering world-class customer service across multiple channels.
* Problem solving: Research and resolve customer questions, concerns and issues quickly and effectively, ensuring a positive customer experience.
* Product knowledge: Develop knowledge of Tibber's products, services and technologies to provide accurate information and assistance to customers.
* Technical support: Helping customers with technical issues related to the Tibber app, smart home devices and integrations such as Smart Charging.
* Billing and account management: Handle questions related to billing, account updates and contracts.
* Providing information: Informing customers about energy-saving opportunities, sustainability and how Tibber's services can contribute to this.
* Documentation: Accurately maintain records of interactions with customers, processing feedback and resolving issues in our CRM system.
* Process Improvement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify process improvements and contribute to customer service optimization.
* Feedback Loop: You are the voice of the customer within Tibber in terms of insights and providing feedback to constantly improve our products and services.


****⚡⚡️Ideal Profile****
*We don't expect the perfect profile, but it would look something like this:*
* You have strong communication skills. both written and verbal. Due to the specialization on the Swedish market, tickets (or messages) and general customer communication is mostly in Swedish and our business language is English, fluency in both languages is a requirement.
* You enjoy helping. You have experience in customer service or another relevant field.
* You have a customer-oriented mentality and an empathetic attitude.
* You are able to solve problems quickly, effectively and efficiently.
* You are technically literate. You are comfortable in a technology-driven environment and you quickly master working in different programmes.
* You are interested in our smart products and services, find sustainability an important business aspect and see the relevance of energy-saving solutions.


**💆🏻‍♀️💆🏽‍♂️The Tibber Mindset**
 Tibber is not your typical energy supplier. Our tech helps hundreds of thousands of households lower and shift their energy consumption to more sustainable and affordable hours. We’re here to accelerate the energy transition – not in theory, but in everyday life.
   

  

 Being on a mission to change an industry, fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users. We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our own products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
   

  

 Starting out with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki. We will continue to grow within our markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
   

  

*Diversity of thought fuels better products, so we welcome applicants of every background, identity and lived experience. Ready to be part of powering the energy transition?* 
***Apply below!***
 Tibber is a different company in a very traditional industry. We are aiming to create the best digital tool so that you as a user can apply new technologies to reduce energy consumption and power costs.

title: Tekniker till servicedesk (vikariat), IT-avdelningen på Ersta diakoni
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Ersta diakoni är Sveriges största idéburna aktör inom vård och omsorg. Vi bedriver sjukvård, socialt arbete, forskning och utbildning, professionellt och utan vinstsyfte.
   

  

 Servicedesk är IT-avdelningens ansikte utåt mot verksamheterna. Idag består gruppen av 6 medarbetare.
   

  

 Som medarbetare hos oss erbjuder vi en rad förmåner som vi hoppas ska ge dig förutsättningar att trivas på jobbet och ha en givande fritid.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Du kommer att jobba med:
   

  

* Att ta emot och hantera IT-relaterade ärenden via telefon och ärendehanteringssystem.
* Felsökning och support av datorer, skrivare, nätverk och mobila enheter.
* Installation, konfiguration och uppdatering av mjukvara och operativsystem.
* Användarsupport i Microsoft 365, Windows och andra vanliga applikationer.
* Behörighetsadministration och kontohantering i Active Directory.
* Dokumentation av ärenden, lösningar och rutiner enligt gällande processer.
* Att samarbeta med andra IT-team för att eskalera och lösa mer komplexa problem.
* Att bidra till förbättring av servicedeskens arbetssätt och kundnöjdhet.


 Rollen sträcker sig till slutet av mars 2026 med möjlighet till förlängning.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är en lösningsorienterad person med ett genuint intresse för IT och service. Du trivs med att hjälpa andra och har förmågan att kommunicera tydligt och pedagogiskt, både muntligt och skriftligt. Du är strukturerad, ansvarstagande och har lätt för att samarbeta med kollegor i olika delar av organisationen. Att arbeta i ett högt tempo med varierande arbetsuppgifter ser du som stimulerande, och du har en god förmåga att prioritera när det behövs.
   

  

 Du delar Erstas värdegrund om att se hela människan och våra värdeord; professionalism, tillit och hopp.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 Du har arbetat i servicedesk på 1st eller 2nd line-nivå under ett par års tid och är van vid att ge support till användare med varierande teknisk kompetens. Du har god erfarenhet av att hantera ärenden i ett strukturerat ärendehanteringssystem och är trygg i felsökning inom både Windowsmiljö och Microsoft 365.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem
* Erfarenhet av felsökning i Office 365 och Windows
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Exchange
* Tidigare arbetat med användar- och behörighetsadministration i Active Directory
* Förståelse för vikten av dokumentation för att underlätta framtida felsökning
* Förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter parallellt och trivs med ett högt tempo


 Meriterande är:
   

  

* Eftergymnasial IT-utbildning eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom hälso- och sjukvård
* Erfarenhet av Intune
* Erfarenhet av avancerad felsökning i Windows
* Erfarenhet av felsökning i Microsoft 365 Admin Center


**Övrigt om rekryteringen**
 Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar provanställning som standard.
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Jonathan Neuman, servicedeskchef, jonathan.neuman@erstadiakoni.se
   

  

 Facklig kontaktperson: Fiona Cameron, SACO,
 **Fiona.cameron@erstadiakoni.se**
 Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-31
   

  

*Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post.*
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Fältservicetekniker inom IT
description:
Är du en tekniker som trivs bäst ute på fältet och gillar att lösa problem direkt hos kund? Har du erfarenhet av att installera och felsöka allt från nätverksutrustning till kassasystem och servrar? Då kan detta uppdrag i Kista vara helt rätt för dig!
 



  





 Just nu söker vi en fältservicetekniker till ett uppdrag hos en av våra kunder – en roll där du inledningsvis anställs av Centric, med goda möjligheter att på sikt gå över i anställning hos kunden.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Du kommer att arbeta i en bred och praktisk teknisk roll, med stort eget ansvar och mycket kundkontakt. Uppdraget är baserat i Stockholm med omnejd, men du utgår från något av kundens kontor och rör dig dagligen ute hos deras kunder i regionen.
 



  





 I rollen som fältservicetekniker arbetar du ute hos kundens kunder och hanterar allt från installation till felsökning och reparation av olika typer av teknisk utrustning. Du jobbar både självständigt och tillsammans med kollegor i olika typer av projekt och serviceuppdrag. Kunderna finns inom bland annat finans, handel och kontorsmiljö.
 



  





*Du kommer bland annat att arbeta med:* 




 • Installation och felsökning av kassasystem, scannrar och arbetsstationer
 



 • Bankomater – installation, underhåll och felsökning
 



 • PC- och servermiljöer – både hårdvaruinstallationer och operativsystem (Windows)
 



 • Nätverkskomponenter – switchar, accesspunkter, routing
 



 • Installation och konfiguration av mjukvara samt grundläggande felsökning
 



 • Incidenthantering och IMAC-tjänster (Install, Move, Add, Change)
 



  





 Du rör dig främst inom Storstockholm, men resor till närliggande orter som Uppsala förekommer regelbundet. Körkort är därför ett krav.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 För att lyckas i rollen som fältservicetekniker behöver du ha ett tekniskt driv och ett lösningsorienterat arbetssätt. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta praktiskt med IT-utrustning – gärna i fält eller onsite hos kund – och är van vid att ta ansvar för hela kedjan från installation till felsökning och dokumentation.
 



  





*Vi söker dig som har:* 




 • Minst ett par års erfarenhet av IT-support, fältservice eller liknande teknisk roll
 



 • Goda kunskaper inom hårdvara, nätverk och Windows-miljöer
 



 • Erfarenhet av att arbeta med PC, servrar, skrivare och nätverksutrustning
 



 • Förmåga att felsöka både hårdvara och mjukvara
 



 • Svenska och engelska flytande - i tal och skrift
 



 • B-körkort
 



  





*Meriterande:* 




 • Erfarenhet av arbete med kassasystem eller bankomater
 



 • Tidigare arbete med IMAC-tjänster eller teknisk fältservice
 



 • Certifieringar inom Microsoft, nätverk eller liknande områden
 



  





 Som person är du kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en roll där du får vara flexibel. Du har ett stort tekniskt intresse och tycker om att vara den som får saker att fungera – oavsett om det gäller ett trasigt nätverk eller en nyinstallation i butiksmiljö.
 



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 Vi hjälper dig att nå dina personliga mål. Vi tycker nämligen att alla våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas, oavsett om de är juniorer eller har några år på nacken. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Och inte nog med det – du som konsult får även lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan utifrån dina speciella intresseområden, där vi tar notan för både studiematerial och certifieringar. Hos oss på Centric kommer du snabbt in i gemenskapen genom våra interna och externa aktiviteter där vi träffas och hittar på något roligt tillsammans.
 



  





 Centric är ett IT-företag med ca 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Motion Designer
description:
**Who We’re Looking For**
 Join Quartr as a Motion Designer to help us bring our brand and products to life in new, visually stunning ways.
   

  

 As our Motion Designer, you’ll take the lead on creating bold, polished, and high-impact motion graphics that elevate our marketing, brand, and product storytelling. You’ll work closely with marketing, product, and content teams to craft visuals that capture attention and strengthen Quartr’s position as a global leader.
   

  

**Note: Please include a portfolio of your work for review when applying.**
**Why join Quartr**
**Do your life's work:** 
 We focus passionately on doing things with a very high quality across our entire organization.
   

  

**Join the foundational team:** 
 We are still in the very early innings of what we believe to be a multi-decade journey.
   

  

**Skin in the game:** 
 We truly believe in the power of incentives and in sharing the company's success with the team. Therefore, every employee is offered qualified stock options.
   

  

**Rapid, global growth:** 
 Among our clients are some of the world's most influential companies in finance and tech. With proven products and a go-to-market strategy, we're steadily capturing market share in a multi-billion-dollar industry.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create high-quality motion graphics, animations, and videos for marketing campaigns, product launches, and brand storytelling.
* Collaborate with marketing and product teams to translate concepts into compelling visual narratives.
* Maintain and evolve our motion design guidelines to keep the Quartr brand sharp and consistent.
* Experiment with new formats and creative techniques to push boundaries and keep our content fresh.


**Required Skills**
* 3–5 years of professional motion design experience.
* A portfolio that showcases exceptional motion work, attention to detail, and creative thinking.
* Strong eye for typography, composition, and visual rhythm.
* Comfort working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.


**Desired qualities**
* Be self-driven, proactive, and take full ownership of your projects
* Communicate clearly and effectively, thriving in a high-paced, collaborative environment
* Creative storytelling mindset - can turn complex financial and product concepts into engaging, dynamic motion pieces that resonate with a global audience
* Comfortably integrate AI tools (e.g., Runway, Midjourney, After Effects plugins) to ideate, generate assets, or accelerate editing, while keeping a human creative edge.
* Strong brand sensibility – understand how to translate Quartr’s visual identity into motion while keeping it consistent, modern, and differentiated.


**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary
* Company option plan
* Top-notch equipment of your choice
* Wellness allowance
* Occupational pension
* Must be based in Sweden with a valid work permit


**Note: We are not seeking assistance from consultants or recruitment agencies.**
**About Quartr**
 Every day, leading companies and financial institutions worldwide rely on Quartr to make better decisions faster. The product suite includes: Quartr API, enabling third parties to build custom solutions powered by Quartr's unique live earnings calls and transcription technology, and its extensive global database of IR material – including public company filings, archived earnings call transcripts, and slide deck presentations. Quartr Pro, a desktop research platform that increases efficiency and precision in qualitative public market research for top hedge funds, asset managers, equity research departments, and IR professionals. A free mobile app allowing users to always stay informed and conduct research anytime, anywhere.

title: Personal and Team Assistant (f/m/d)
description:
**Your mission**
 As Personal and Team Assistant, you'll keep our leadership and internal teams running smoothly. You’ll support our CEO and leadership team with day-to-day coordination, help our teams stay connected and organized, and take care of the operational tasks that keep the company humming.
   

  

 This role is a mix of classic executive assistance, team coordination, and office admin. It’s hands-on, varied, and central to how we work together.
   

  

 YOUR TASKS
   

  

**Executive Support**
* Manage calendars, schedule meetings, and coordinate appointments for the CEO and leadership team
* Support travel planning, bookings, and expense handling
* Work with sensitive information with care and discretion
* Help prepare presentations, reports, and internal documents


**Team Coordination**
* Organize team offsites, events, and internal meetings
* Keep shared calendars, tools, and documentation tidy and up to date
* Support onboarding of new colleagues together with our People and IT teams
* Help shape strong team culture and communication across departments


**Office & Admin Operations**
* Keep our office space functional and welcoming (supplies, shipments, facility contact)
* Be the go-to person for external service providers and vendors
* Help with invoice processing and keep an eye on simple budget tracking
* Maintain digital and physical filing systems


**Your profile**
* Experience in a similar role – e.g. Executive Assistant, Office Manager, or Team Assistant
* Fluent in English and Swedish; German is a plus
* Strong organisational skills and eye for detail
* A hands-on, proactive mindset – you see what needs doing and do it
* Comfortable using Microsoft Office (or similar tools)
* A positive, team-oriented attitude


**Why us?**
* A front-row seat to the strategic and financial engine room of a growing climate-tech company
* The chance to learn directly from (and challenge) our leadership team
* Ownership, autonomy, and the opportunity to scale your impact quickly
* A mission-driven culture, flat hierarchy, and a highly collaborative team


**About Us**
 Join the Energy Revolution!
   

  

 Are you ready to make a real impact in the world of energy? Join us in driving the transition to renewable energy and be part of an exciting journey towards a more sustainable future.
   

  

 Our Mission: We are on a mission to power the planet with positive energy. Our vision is to be the leading force in renewable energy through pioneering new technologies.
   

  

 What We Do: We develop a patented nano-paste screen-printing technology. It’s used in manufacturing of solar cells, batteries and heating, proven to have superior performance, at a much lower cost and a near-zero impact on the environment. Our technology is manufactured in Europe using only abundant non-toxic materials.
   

  

 Your Role: Be part of groundbreaking projects, including from developing cutting-edge solar cell printing techniques to crafting game-changing solid-state batteries and ultra-efficient electric heaters, your contributions will directly impact the future of renewable energy.
   

  

 Why Join Us: Work with a passionate, international team in an inclusive environment where your ideas matter. At our company, creativity and boldness are celebrated, and your work will help shape a cleaner, greener future.
   

  

 Your Opportunity: Don’t wait for change—create it! Join us in revolutionizing the energy industry and making a lasting positive impact on the world by applying today!

title: Head of Operations Defence & Security, Business Area Training
description:
**W5 Solutions – For a Safer Future**
 W5 Solutions develops and delivers cutting-edge systems and solutions for defence and civil protection, serving Swedish and international government agencies as well as industry partners. With a strong focus on sustainability and innovation, we provide advanced solutions in
 *Training, Power, and Integration* 
 , strengthening both our own forces and those of our allies.
   

  

 Beyond our core technologies, we offer comprehensive support services, including training, repair, and maintenance, ensuring long-term operational readiness. As a trusted partner, we are committed to shaping the future of defence and security worldwide.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As the Head of Operations for the product area within the business area Training, you will hold a pivotal position in shaping, developing, and overseeing our operations related to a diverse range of training systems—an area experiencing rapid growth and carrying substantial strategic importance for W5 Solutions.
   

  

 As Head of Operation for the product area Defence & Security you will be responsible for both day-to-day operations and the long-term advancement of the product area, leading managers, project managers, technicians, and other key personnel. Your role will be to ensure that the product area consistently meets its objectives concerning delivery capacity, quality, customer satisfaction, and profitability. This position requires close collaboration with our sales, product, and development teams, as well as direct engagement with customers.
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Business Area for Training and will be an integral member of the management team within the business area.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead and continuously develop the operational activities within the product area.
* Ensure high-quality project delivery and effective resource planning.
* Support and mentor key personnel across various roles.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives and enhance operational efficiency.
* Monitor and be accountable for KPIs, budgets, and overall performance outcomes.
* Contribute to business development efforts, tender processes, and strategic decision-making.
* Identify, assess, and manage risks while ensuring compliance with customer specifications and relevant regulations.


**Candidate Profile**
 We are seeking an individual with substantial experience in operational leadership, ideally within the defence industry or other technology-intensive sectors. You possess a strategic mindset, with the ability to balance a broad perspective with a keen attention to detail. Your leadership style fosters structure, engagement, and tangible results.
   

  

 You are adept at leading through others and are comfortable assuming overall business responsibility. You welcome change and see it as an opportunity for development. The ideal candidate thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments where collaboration and clear communication are essential for success.
   

  

**We believe you bring:**
* A minimum of 10 years’ experience in senior operational roles within the technology or defence sector.
* Demonstrated expertise in project and resource management.
* A solid understanding of requirements management, system deliveries, and complex customer-driven projects.
* Proven ability to lead through others and build high-performing teams.
* Strong communication skills combined with a commercially driven approach.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, in both spoken and written forms.


**What We Offer**
 When you join W5 Solutions, you get more than just a job – you become part of a community where your expertise is valued, and your development is a priority. We offer a stimulating work environment with varied and meaningful tasks, modern technical solutions, and a clear connection to the needs of society.
   

  

 Here, you’ll have the opportunity to grow both professionally and personally, collaborate closely with dedicated and knowledgeable colleagues, and contribute to projects that truly make a difference. We value team spirit, a healthy work–life balance, and a culture where ideas are encouraged, and every team member is recognised as an important part of the whole.
   

  

 W5 Solutions is an attractive employer for those seeking a professional environment where their skills are nurtured and where they can contribute to development that truly matters.

title: Mechatronics Engineer
company_industry: Engineering Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Cleeven is a consulting group specializing in Engineering, R&D, and IT services. We support our clients in driving innovation, enhancing R&D capabilities, and achieving operational excellence across a broad range of sectors—energy, banking and services, aerospace and defense, transportation, pharmaceuticals and chemicals, as well as IT and telecoms.
 



  





 We are expanding and looking for
 **talented, passionate Mechatronics Engineers** 
 to join our dynamic team. In this role, you’ll be a key contributor in designing and delivering innovative solutions across cutting-edge projects in diverse industries.
 



  





**Your Profile** 




  




* You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechatronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* You have at least
 **1 year of hands-on experience** 
 in a relevant engineering role.
* You’re curious, technically driven, and eager to tackle complex challenges.
* You communicate easily with end users and can effectively gather and synthesize their requirements.
* You’re a proactive problem solver who works independently and takes ownership of your tasks.
* You are fluent in English.



  





 As a Mechatronics Engineer, you’ll be part of the R&D departments of our clients—leading companies in high-tech and consumer technology sectors. You’ll contribute to the full product development lifecycle, including:
 



  




* Requirements analysis
* Electrical and electronic architecture design
* Control strategy development
* Embedded software implementation



  





 The most common technical tools and programming languages we use on our projects in this field are:
 


* System Modelling and Simulation:
 ***Matlab - Simulink***
* Electrical design:
 **EPLAN, COMOS**
* Electronic Design/Simulation:
 **Altium, Eagle, PSPICE or LTPSICE**
* Development on PLC:
 **Ladder Logic, FBD or Structured text**
* Development on microcontrollers :
 **C, C++**
* Methodologies:
 ***Scrum / Agile***

title: Salesperson
description:
**Börja din karriär inom B2B-försäljning – med stöd från experterna hos MPWR** 
 🚀
 



  





 Vill du in i techvärlden och få en stark grund inom försäljning?
 



**MPWR Consulting** 
 söker en ny mötesbokare till teamet i
 **Stockholm eller Örebro** 
 – en roll där du får jobba mot spännande bolag, coachas löpande och utvecklas snabbt.

* Är social, nyfiken och gillar att ta initiativ
* Pratar svenska eller norska flytande

title: Solutions Architect
description:
Where Data Does More. Join the Snowflake team.
   

  

 We are looking for data experts who have a strong background in building data platforms and love to use their skills to supercharge data teams. Our team helps customers on their data journey with Snowflake, which is very fast becoming the central data platform for companies big and small. That means you will work on some of the most challenging data projects you can find, in a post-sales capacity.
   

  

 We are hiring a range of seniority levels, though we do not currently hire people without relevant experience. During the interview process, we will form a view on your current level of expertise and match it to our internal career levels.
   

  

**What we are offering:**
**We help each other to stay on top of the game** 
 and up-to-date with the latest features in the Snowflake Data Cloud. Snowflake had the biggest software IPO of all times and we continue to grow at a rapid pace, which means there is ample opportunity to change the future of data analytics by joining us. Not only will you work with Snowflakes latest and greatest capabilities, but also t
 **he cutting edge technologies of our partners** 
**.**
 Our
 **compensation package** 
 offers a very competitive salary, plus equity on top. We are looking after the work life balance of our employees, which means our annual vacation is at the top of the market. We also have Snowdays - have a look at
 **this LinkedIn post** 
 or other #snowday tagged posts from Snowflakes around the world.
   

  

 For young families we are offering
 **very attractive parental leave** 
 and support with adoption, surrogacy, pregnancy or infant care related questions. Private medical and insurance plans are part of our benefits, in markets where this is a customary employment benefit. Furthermore we provide strong private pension plans and other benefits, tailored to your country of employment.
   

  

**Who we are:**
 The Snowflake Data Cloud was built from the ground up for the modern cloud, which means we can easily scale from empowering small start-ups to the largest companies in the world.
   

  

 It is our mission to
 **mobilize the world's data** 
 , so that businesses can be truly data driven. We think it is important that our platform is easy to use, which allows us to power companies at all stages of the data maturity journey.
 **Here** 
 you can find examples of how we have helped companies in a wide range of industries.
   

  

 We have seen a tremendous amount of success with our platform and continue to grow at a very fast pace, both in Europe and worldwide. That means we are constantly adapting the way we work and input is welcome from everybody on the team, which gives you the chance to make an impact.
   

  

**What we do:**
 We are the professional services team of Snowflake, which means we help our customers by
 **creating solutions that shape their businesses** 
 . Once our customers have made the decision to implement Snowflake, we accompany them in their journey with us.
   

  

 This journey might start with our migrations team, who help our customers to plan and execute the migration of their data to Snowflake. Or it might begin with a Quick Start consultation, where we simultaneously explain best practices for working with Snowflake and translate them to our customers' specific use case.
   

  

 After a period of time we might return to analyse our customers progress and provide further guidance. We might also look at specific topics such as their security posture.
   

  

 Other customers prefer a more continuous engagement with us. In these cases we stay with them for a year or longer, in order to guide them from the initial setup of the platform all the way to advanced use cases that solve their trickiest challenges.
   

  

**How we work:**
 We
 **provide guidance** 
 to our customers. For most implementation work, we partner with our customers' engineering teams or members of our partner network.
   

  

 While our core expertise is Snowflake, our platform is almost always at the centre of larger data architectures, which we help to design. Examples include architecting for GDPR or integrating with existing data lakes.
   

  

 In addition to helping our customers,
 **we help each other** 
 by answering questions on our internal Slack channels, writing content for our internal knowledge base or organising internal lunch and learn sessions.
   

  

 Currently we work
 **mostly remote** 
 , which has proven to be successful. While we do have region specific practices, we work with customers from across Europe. A consultant from Finland might for example work with a customer in the Netherlands. Internally we work together as a global team.
   

  

**What are we looking for:**
 People who have a strong background in building
 **data platforms** 
 and working on the surrounding data landscape. Some of our colleagues have a stronger background in
 **data warehousing, data engineering** 
 , while others might be more at home on the
 **data science or analytics** 
 side. The data warehouse is where we all come together.
   

  

 Our ideal candidate can translate vague business requirements into technical requirements, find the appropriate solution and communicate both its technical merits and the business impact to stakeholders at different seniority levels. We are constantly adding new features, so explaining new concepts is essential for our success.
   

  

 Since Snowflake is only available in the cloud, having experience of architecting solutions on AWS, Azure or GCP is a big plus. Similarly, having experience with data security, governance and discoverability concepts will be helpful in this role.
   

  

 While
 **SQL** 
 is a language everybody on the team knows very well, Snowflake is fast evolving to allow native integrations with
 **Python, Java** 
 and
 **Scala** 
 & with
 **Snowpark** 
 , if you have experience with
 **Spark** 
 you will definitely be able to put these skills to good use.
   

  

**DataOps** 
 or
 **DevOps** 
 for data teams is getting ever more important. Setting up
 **CI/CD** 
 pipelines with automated tests and rollback capabilities is an activity we regularly engage in.
   

  

**Bonus points to have:**
 We think Data Sharing will play a big role in the next generation of data cloud so if you are familiar with
 **Data Sharing** 
 &
 **Data Marketplace** 
 implementation that would be a big advantage.
   

  

 Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.
   

  

 How do you want to make your impact?
   

  

 For jobs located in the United States, please visit the job posting on the Snowflake Careers Site for salary and benefits information: careers.snowflake.com

title: Cybersecurity Consultant
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Come work with us** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**What does it mean to be a Cybersecurity Consultant at Netlight?** 




 It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar with your experience, and from there it is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like.
 



  





 You will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.
 



  





 Specifically as a Cybersecurity Consultant, you will collaborate with other Netlighters and clients in Stockholm and across offices. It can be working as Security Engineer, Information Security Engineer, Security Architect, Security Analyst, Solution Engineering, Site Reliability Engineer, DevSecOps Engineer, Security Lead, Security Manager, Security Officer, Secure Cloud Architect, it can be working in a backend role building a secure system, it can be working as part of a security advisory team, Project Manager of building a secure system, or being part of a Technical Due Diligence project bringing the security perspectives, to give some examples. In parallel to this, you will be an important part of improving our Cybersecurity work and being an important part of our passionate Cybersecurity community at Netlight.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
* Verbal and written fluency in English is required, and meriting with Swedish/Danish/Norwegian
* 0,5-5 years of work experience with Cybersecurity, Information Security or building secure systems
* International mindset, as you will collaborate with Netlighters and clients across offices.



  





**Application** 




 We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We try to get in touch within two weeks
 
 if
 
 we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

title: Cybersecurity architect Getinge
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 The Cybersecurity Center of excellence at our Solna office supports our R&D teams and regulatory to make sure that standards and regulatory requirements are fulfilled throughout the lifecycle of our Critical Care products. Our products are complex and specialized both in design and the requirements they need to fulfill and with the challenges in the world around us, we play an important role in keeping our products safe and reliable for our end users.
   

  

 The team currently consists of five persons, and we are now looking forward to expanding the team with our next Cyber Security Architect.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 In this role, you will work closely with Critical Cares different product development teams and provide expert knowledge of the security aspects of their work. You will be supporting with both methodology and technical solutions.
   

  

 Your daily work will be to drive and support the teams with:
   

  

* Product threat modelling, risk analysis and risk mitigation.
* Secure design architecture for embedded and server-based solutions for our products.
* Secure coding practices and tool support.
* Training to increase understanding of the need for, and implementation of security solutions.
* Ensuring standard and regulatory requirement fulfillment in Getinge products.


 This position is based in Solna, Stockholm and may include occasional travel. The position is eligible for a hybrid setup where you can work from home 1-2 days a week.
   

  

**You will bring**
 To be successful in this position, we believe that you have the following qualifications:
   

  

* MSc in Computer Software or equivalent.
