title: Customer Success Advisor | Stockholm | Telenor
description:
Vi på Manpower söker just nu en relationsskapande och proaktiv Customer Success Advisor till Telenor i Stockholm. En stor fördel med det här jobbet är att det är kreativt och utmanande och att dagligen möta olika typer av människor. Ta chansen att bli en del av ett välkänt, stort och expansivt företag i en långsiktig roll med många utvecklingsmöjligheter!
   

  

 Det här är ett konsultuppdrag som innebär att du kommer att vara anställd av Manpower men arbeta hos Telenor. Tjänsten är på heltid och dina arbetstider kommer att vara kontorstid.
   

  

**Att jobba som Customer Success Advisor**
 I rollen som Customer Success Advisor kommer du att arbeta i ett team som dagligen hjälper Telenors företagskunder över telefon och digitala kanaler. Din roll blir att utveckla starka relationer med Telenors kunder, skapa en hög förståelse för kundens verksamhet och leverera en kundupplevelse i världsklass. En viktig uppgift är att arbeta proaktivt där du identifierar potential och erbjuder tjänster som adderar starkt mervärde för kunden. En nyckel för att lyckas är din förmåga att definiera och hantera kundens problem, där du antingen åtgärdar den direkt eller effektivt adresserar den inom organisationen. Du kommer erbjudas goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, och du förväntas också att aktivt söka information i syfte att utöka ditt kompetensområde och förbättra uppdragets förutsättningar.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Till rollen som Customer Success Advisor söker vi framför allt dig som är en kommunikativ och resultatinriktad person som drivs av att få ta egna initiativ och att få jobba med människor. För att trivas i rollen behöver du ha ett genuint intresse för service, att utveckla långsiktiga kundrelationer och en förmåga att hantera komplexa situationer i ett högt tempo. För att komma in i rollen så snabbt som möjligt är det ett stort plus om du har erfarenhet av försäljning och serviceuppdrag inom business to business. Din inställning är att laget går före jaget och att vi är bättre tillsammans.
   

  

**I Övrigt Söker Vi Dig Som**
* Har goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Har en gymnasieexamen
* Har haft yrken med mycket kundkontakt


**Om Manpower**
 Manpower är Sveriges ledande rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag med tiotusentals attraktiva arbetsgivare över hela landet som våra kunder. Med vårt omfattande nätverk, lokalt såväl som globalt, kan vi erbjuda mängder av spännande lediga jobb som hjälper dig att bygga din karriär, både på kort och lång sikt. Hos oss kan du söka heltidsjobb eller extrajobb vid sidan av studierna.
   

  

**Sök tjänsten idag!**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan genom att registrera ditt CV, urval sker löpande. Notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mejl. Vid frågor om tjänsten eller rollen som konsult är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Sofia Reideborn via mail sofia.reideborn1@manpower.se

title: Senior Active Directory Specialist
description:
Har du gedigen erfarenhet av att drifta och utveckla Active Directory i affärskritiska miljöer med höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet? Vi söker en senior specialist inom IAM med fokus på Active Directory, som vill vara en del av ett team som arbetar med hela accessområdet. Vill du dessutom arbeta med teknik i framkant inom försvarsindustrin? Nu har du chansen att bli en del av att bidra till säkerheten i Sverige och världen.
 



 Denna tjänst i Alvik börjar som ett konsultuppdrag men tanken är att den senare ska gå över i en anställning hos vår kund.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 I rollen som Senior Active Directory Specialist kommer du att ansvara för att säkerställa en stabil och säker AD-miljö genom kontinuerlig drift, övervakning och patchning. Du kommer att arbeta med härdning och säkerhetskonfigurering av Active Directory, hantera behörigheter och delegation samt bidra med expertis i IAM-relaterade frågeställningar. Vidare ingår felsökning och incidenthantering, samt uppsättning och drift av viss infrastruktur.
 



 Du kommer även att arbeta proaktivt för att förbättra och effektivisera processer, dokumentation och automatisering, där scripting i PowerShell är en naturlig del av arbetet.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en gedigen bakgrund inom Microsofts ekosystem, med djupgående kunskap inom Azure, Microsoft Defender och PowerShell. Du har en förståelse för moderna DevOps-principer och hur nätverksinfrastrukturer i molnet är uppbyggda.
 



 Som person är du nyfiken och engagerad, med en stark vilja att hålla dig uppdaterad inom nya teknologier och säkerhetslösningar. Du har en god kommunikationsförmåga och trivs med att samarbeta i team, samtidigt som du kan arbeta självständigt och driva projekt framåt.
 



  





*Krav:* 




 • Flerårig erfarenhet av systemadministration i Active Directory
 



 • Djup kunskap inom IAM och identitetshantering
 



 • Förståelse för infrastruktur, nätverk och systemadministration
 



 • Erfarenhet av modern IT-drift, gärna med GitOps-tänk
 



 • Avancerade kunskaper i PowerShell och scripting
 



 Erfarenhet av automatisering i större skala är meriterande.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





*Mer om oss* 




 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: (Senior) Consultant | AI & Data
description:
**Job Description**
 Amsterdam Data Collective is a leading European data and AI consultancy, partnering with organisations to drive responsible and impactful AI transformation. We deliver strategic advice and tailored, end-to-end solutions across sectors including financial services, life sciences, healthcare, the public sector, agriculture, and retail.
   

  

**Our Multidisciplinary Expertise Covers The Full Data Value Chain**
**Data Strategy** 
 – Actionable, business-aligned AI and data roadmaps
   

  

**Data Engineering** 
 – Secure, scalable, future-proof data architectures
   

  

**Analytics & Data Science** 
 – AI-powered tools solving real-world problems
   

  

**Design & Visualisation** 
 – In partnership with our in-house studio CLEVER°FRANKE, we turn complex insights into intuitive user experiences
   

  

 For this position, unfortunately we do not provide relocation support (we sponsor visas), therefore we are looking for candidates
 **living in Sweden.**
 Disclaimer: Because of the summer vacations we’ll only be able to start the interviews in August.
   

  

**What You Do**
* Support the growth of ADC in Sweden and the Nordics through strong delivery and business development
* Manage projects from scoping to execution, aligning stakeholders and ensuring timely delivery
* Build AI solutions that drive real value — from strategy to deployment
* Translate complex business needs into technical solutions and communicate clearly with clients
* Work hands-on in the cloud (infra setup, CI/CD, monitoring)
* Create project plans and estimates and nurture client relationships
* Stay up to date with the evolving AI landscape and apply new developments effectively
* Represent ADC’s values: pragmatism, comprehensiveness, trust, and ownership


**What you bring:** 
  

  

* 2-6 years of working experience in areas such as Data Engineering, Software Engineering, Data Science, Machine Learning, Advanced Analytics or Artificial Intelligence (Consultancy is preferred)
* A quantitative MA degree (e.g., Physics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Data Science, AI, Computer Science)
* Stakeholder management and business development experience
* Hands-on experience and understanding of processing unstructured (text) data, using NLP algorithms or LLMs
* Software development skills and hands-on experience deploying to the cloud (e.g. provisioning infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, monitoring)
* Expertise in programming in Python
* Expertise in AI development frameworks such as LangChain, Autogen, Llamaindex
* Familiarity in Cloud environments
* Expertise in working with databases and database languages
* Excellent command of both English and Swedish


**What We Offer**
 At ADC, we don’t just offer jobs - we offer growth, impact, and a sense of belonging. We empower you to take ownership, build something meaningful, and thrive collectively.
   

  

* A steep learning curve - take on responsibility from day one and grow into a trusted advisor, specialist, or future ADC leader
* Projects that make an impact - where you’ll tackle real-world challenges and drive meaningful change
* Freedom to innovate - bring your ideas to life and help shape the future of risk management
* Ongoing learning & development - with peer groups, project presentations, mentorship programs and Collective Lunch Sharing Sessions
* Our Collective Week - a week with the entire ADC team, where we collaborate on pro bono projects and create unforgettable memories
* A competitive salary with a collective bonus structure - because we believe in rewarding success as a team
* The opportunity to invest in the company, once you meet the conditions
* A welcoming office space in the center of Stockholm. Various social events, including Friday drinks, events, sports activities, etc.


 At ADC, we believe in building with heart—where people, ethics, and impact come first. Ready to join us?
   

  

**What To Do Next**
 If you are inspired by the above, apply through the link below! For questions, contact recruitment@adc-consulting.com.
   

  

* Amsterdam Data Collective is an equal opportunity employer. To shape a better future, we value diversity and promote equality. No characteristics are discriminated against, as indicated in Directive 2000/78/EC. We encourage and welcome all applications. Additional arrangements or adjustments to support your application can be discussed further.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
RED Global are currently hiring for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer for a role with a key client of ours based in Stockholm, Sweden. We are looking for someone who is able to work on site in Stockholm, this role will be a contract opportunity with the vision of getting someone started within the next few weeks and running until the end of Feb 2026 + Likely extensions.
 



  





 We are looking for skills in the following:
 


* Have 5+ years’ professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a senior level Machine Learning Engineer, ideally with experience in supply chain and demand forecasting solutions.
* A hands-on person, with great software engineering skills, who loves coding, and knows how to apply good software engineering practices, DevOps, testing and SRE principals - also for machine learning and AI projects.
* Have extensive experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production and scaled in a bigger organization, also ensuring and fulfilling product quality, cybersecurity and performance requirements.
* Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 4+ years, incl. developing back-end services.
* Have great hands-on experience with cloud technologies for cloud solutions and ML development, ideally Google Cloud Platform, and also including Vertex AI.
* Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, data pipelines and deploying ML applications to production.
* Have a foundational data science background and a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
* Have experience handling and developing for high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream), preferably also including hands-on development in SQL and DBT, and have a solid understanding of cloud data storage technologies and data quality.



  





 If this sounds like something of interest then please apply directly and someone from the team will be in touch to discuss the requirement further.

title: Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management)
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring an
 **Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management)** 
 to build high-performing Go and Python services and secure identity and access management solutions that will be used across all company products. From Ubuntu One SSO to Juju, LXD and MAAS your team will define the way Canonical users, clients and community members access their favorite open source applications.
   

  

 This is an opportunity for a software engineering manager with a passion for distributed systems operations to help us transform the future of identity management at Canonical. Experience in the identity and access management (IAM) field is desirable but not required. You will work with upstream open source projects, alongside internal teams to deliver high quality software that can be deployed on bare metal, public cloud and Kubernetes.
   

  

 As the identity team engineering manager you will bring significant software development experience, Kubernetes knowledge and a keen eye for software design, performance and security. You will be responsible for working with product management to define the technical vision for the products, managing the team backlog, reviewing code and coaching younger team members.
   

  

 You will also be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.
   

  

 In addition to the engineering behind the project itself, you'll have the chance to work with industry-leading teams inside Canonical, ensuring your work is backed by rock-solid data stores, and highly observable using our Kubernetes-based Observability stack. You'll work with broader open source communities, participating in "hackfest" events, webinars and conferences.
   

  

**Location:** 
*This role will be based remotely in the EMEA or AMER regions.*
**What we are looking for in you**
* Proven experience hiring and leading a high performance software engineering team
* Experience with Go and Python software development
* Ability to design and implement complex, distributed system
* Experience working with container technology and Kubernetes
* Strong understanding of software/infrastructure security and performance
* Experience designing and/or operating large scale distributed systems
* Knowledge of identity and access management technologies and standards is desirable but not essential
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Platform Architect
description:
**Data Platform Architect till Sogeti Stockholm.**
 Vi på Sogeti vågar påstå att vi är ett av de mest framåtlutade konsultföretagen när det gäller Data, Analytics och AI. Vi driver transformationsprojekt tillsammans med våra strategiska kunder, alltifrån nya ekosystem av tjänster och samarbeten kring avancerad analys av satellitbilder, till införande av moderna dataplattformar hos multinationella företag.
   

  

**Din roll:**
 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren Dataplattformsarkitekt och som är grym på att vägleda kring och skapa skalbara, robusta och moderna dataplattformar. Vi söker dig som brinner för att skapa värde för våra kunder och som både kan leda och vara "hands-on" i att designa, bygga, migrera till och optimera dataplattformar. Vi söker dig som kombinerar djup teknisk kompetens med en stark kommunikativ förmåga.
   

  

**I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:**
* Designa, implementera och optimera dataplattformar.
* Arbeta med dataarkitektur och datamodellering till säkerhetsmodeller och datastyrning.
* Skapa lösningsförslag, leda implementationer och säkerställa kvalitet i leveranserna.
* Val av teknologier och verktyg, definiera scheman och etablera datastyrningspraxis för att säkerställa säker och skalbar arkitektur.
* Bygga och underhålla ETL-flöden, extrahera, transformera och ladda data från olika källor med fokus på pålitlighet och effektivitet.
* Implementera säkerhetspolicys och säkerställa att plattformen följer dataskyddsregler som GDPR.
* Utveckla strategier för datalagring och optimering för snabb åtkomst och kostnadseffektivitet.
* Stödja flera datakällor, designa framtidssäkra lösningar för datahantering, dataflöden och integrationer.
* Presentera tekniska lösningar på ett engagerande sätt för olika målgrupper.
* Bygga och leda team samt driva leveranser mot uppsatta mål.


**Din profil:**
* Minst fem års erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och leda migrering, införande och förvaltning av dataplattformslösningar.
* Erfarenhet av tekniker som Teradata, Databricks, Snowflake, Synapse, Ab Initio, Mainframe, Informatica, PowerCenter, PowerShell, SQL, Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Data Fabric, ETL, Power BI och DataOps.
* Förmåga att agera rådgivande och driva diskussioner med olika intressenter, både under införande och i leveranser.
* Passion för data och tekniska lösningar och en vilja att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt.
* Stark lagspelare med förmåga att samarbeta i tvärfunktionella agila team.
* Självständig, initiativrik och en problemlösare som balanserar detaljer med helhetsperspektiv.
* Tala och skriva flytande svenska och engelska.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
**Innovativ miljö:** 
 Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
   

  

**Karriärutveckling** 
 : Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

**Flexibelt arbete:** 
 Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
   

  

**Teamkänsla:** 
 Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.
   

  

**Ansökan:**
 Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Johan Alsén på johan.alsen@sogeti.se
   

  

 Genväg för snabb kontakt innan du ansöker? Självklart! Vi är bara två klick och ett micro-formulär bort. Första klicket
 **klicket här** 
 och du är igång.
   

  

 Nu när sommaren är här och många av oss njuter av lite välförtjänt ledighet, kan det hända att processen tar lite längre tid än vanligt. Vi återkommer så snart vi är tillbaka från semestern! Tack för ditt tålamod och för att du visat intresse för oss på Sogeti. Vi önskar dig en riktigt härlig sommar fylld med sol, vila och glädje!
   

  

**Om oss**
 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 21 kontor och 1300 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Solution Consultant Manager
company_industry: Construction, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Civil Engineering
description:
**Vad söker vi?**
 Vill du skapa verklig påverkan i en affärsdriven och inflytelserik roll? Vill du utvecklas i ditt ledarskap och söker ett bolag med många karriärmöjligheter även internationellt? Vi söker dig som har en passion för sälj och ledarskap och som vill leda ett engagerat team till nya framgångar. Som Solution Consultant Manager hos Hilti får du möjligheten att kombinera strategiskt och operativt arbete i en roll där du är avgörande för att driva förändring och skapa värde för våra kunder. Du och ditt team är en viktig nyckel i Hiltis affärsstrategi.
   

  

**Vilka är Hilti?**
 På Hilti arbetar vi engagerat över hela världen för att göra byggbranschen bättre. Som en pålitlig partner med fokus på produktivitet, säkerhet och hållbarhet erbjuder vi våra kunder innovativa lösningar som påverkar och formar de byggnader, vägar och den infrastruktur som människor dagligen förlitar sig på.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa och äga din egen utveckling för att nå din fulla potential och bygga en långsiktig karriär. Din insats gör en betydande skillnad varje dag – samtidigt som vi tillsammans formar framtidens byggbransch.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
 I rollen som Solution Consultant Manager kommer du kombinera strategiskt och operativt arbete samtidigt som du coachar ett nationellt team om sju personer. Strategiskt kommer du, tillsammans med ditt team, vara en partner till försäljningsorganisationen på Hilti Sverige och agera förändringsledare för nya arbetssätt. Operativt spelar du och ditt team en avgörande roll i större affärer med fokus på att sälja in Hiltis mjukvarulösningar för verktyg och tjänster - ON!Track och Fleet.
   

  

 Du och ditt team av Solution Consultants och Specialists jobbar nära våra ca 200 säljare och säljchefer. Tillsammans träffar ni kunder för att identifiera kostnadsbesparingar, tillämpa våra tekniska mjukvarulösningar och servicekoncept samt utarbeta affärsförslag.
   

  

 I rollen rapporterar du till Marknadsdirektören i den svenska ledningsgruppen, och du utgår från vårt Stockholmskontor. Dina arbetsuppgifter innefattar bland annat att:
   

  

* Leda och utveckla ett seniort, nationellt team av Solution Consultants och Implementation & Service Specialists.
* Delta i marknads ledningsgrupp och bidra till affärsstrategin
* Implementera försäljningsstrategier inom ditt affärsområde som driver tillväxt och lönsamhet
* Resa inom Sverige för att stötta medarbetarna i deras dagliga arbete. På sikt kommer du ha medarbetare från Luleå till Malmö.
* Bygga långsiktiga relationer med kunder och interna partners
* Identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter och analysera marknadstrender


**Hilti Svenska AB har under mer än 10 års tid varit på listan för Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser i Great Place to Works undersökning i kategorin stora organisationer.**
**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 För rätt kandidat finns flera karriärmöjligheter exempelvis inom Sälj eller Marketing, både nationellt och internationellt. Vi ger dig alla förutsättningar för att nå framgång i din roll vilket bland annat inkluderar utomordentlig utbildning, egen förmånsbil samt nära coaching och stöd från chef och kollegor. Du kommer att möta en unik kombination av självständighet och kamratskap, där du hanterar din egen planering samtidigt som du är en del av ett inkluderande team samt har ett nära samarbete med andra avdelningar i organisationen. Vi kommer att ge dig stort eget ansvar och frihet att planera din dag. Vi har förtroende för att du gör vad som krävs för att leverera enastående resultat och kan i gengäld erbjuda goda möjligheter till utveckling såväl nationellt som internationellt.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder ett brett flexibilitetskoncept med friskvårdsbidrag, friskvårdstimme, pensionsgrundande bonus samt andra förmåner.
   

  

**Vi önskar att du:**
* Har minst 2–3 års erfarenhet av ledarskap
* Har en högskole-/universitetsexamen, eller motsvarande kompetens
* Har en hög analytisk förmåga och affärsförståelse för att kunna koppla ett övergripande kundbehov till Hitis serviceerbjudande
* Har entreprenörsanda, arbetar lösningsorienterat och ser positivt på förändring och nya arbetssätt
* Har en god förmåga och erfarenhet av att driva resultat genom andra
* Har en god kommunikativ förmåga i tal och skrift, både i svenska och engelska


**Varför ska du söka?**
 Vi har en utmärkt blandning av människor och erfarenheter i våra team. Några av våra duktigaste medarbetare började på Hilti utan erfarenhet från branschen. Framgång på Hilti handlar om teamwork och förmåga, oavsett din bakgrund. Som Solution Consultant Manager har du förmånen att arbeta med både strategiska och operativa frågor. Du kommer spela en central roll i bolagets strategi framöver.
   

  

 Visst låter det intressant? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Skulle du gå vidare i rekryteringsprocessen erbjuds du en första digital videointervju som följs av ytterligare två intervjuer. Mot slutet av rekryteringsprocessen genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll samt referenstagning och alkohol & drogtest.
   

  

 Har du frågor om rollen eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta vårt rekryteringsteam på seteamrecruitment@hilti.com .
 **Urval och intervjuer för tjänsten kommer äga rum först i augusti**
**Här är några saker du kan förvänta dig under processens gång:**
* Vi anser att varje ansökan förtjänar en mänsklig bedömning. Därför granskas samtliga ansökningar noggrant av en av våra rekryterare.
* När du skickat in din ansökan kan du förvänta dig automatiska bekräftelser och meddelanden från vårt system – initierat av vårt rekryteringsteam .
* Väljer vi att inte gå vidare med just din ansökan för en personlig intervju, kommer vi tyvärr inte att kunna ge individuell feedback.
* Vi återkommer med besked så snart vi kan. Rekryteringsprocessen tar vanligtvis 4–6 veckor, och i snitt får du svar inom 2–3 veckor, oavsett om vi går vidare med din ansökan eller inte.
* För att ge dig bästa möjliga förutsättningar i rekryteringsprocessen, har vi samlat några användbara tips och vanliga frågor här:


 Tips inför din intervju: Interview Tips | Hilti Careers
   

  

 Vanliga frågor: FAQs | Hilti Careers
   

  

 Vi hoppas att du känner dig väl förberedd och ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior Data Engineer- Databricks and Data Products
description:
**Job Description:** 

 We are seeking an experienced
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 with strong hands-on expertise in
 **Databricks** 
 and
 **Data Product development** 
 to join our client’s team onsite in
 **Stockholm** 
 . This role is ideal for someone who combines deep technical skills with a product-oriented mindset and thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
 


**Key Responsibilities:** 
1. Design, develop, and optimize scalable data pipelines using
 **Databricks** 
 , Spark, and cloud platforms.
2. Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders to deliver high-quality data products.
3. Implement and maintain data architecture, modeling, and engineering best practices.
4. Ensure data quality, governance, and performance standards across pipelines.
5. Support the full data product lifecycle—from ideation and prototyping to deployment and maintenance.
6. Contribute to defining data engineering standards and driving continuous improvement initiatives.


**Required Skills & Experience:** 
1. 5+ years of experience in
 **data engineering** 
 roles.
2. Strong hands-on experience with
 **Databricks** 
 , Spark, and at least one major cloud platform (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
3. Experience in building and maintaining
 **data products** 
 in an enterprise environment.
4. Proficient in Python/Scala, SQL, and cloud-native data tools.
5. Deep understanding of data architecture, data modeling, and pipeline performance optimization.
6. Comfortable working in
 **agile** 
 , cross-functional teams.


**Nice to Have:** 
1. Familiarity with data mesh, data fabric, or domain-oriented data architecture.
2. Experience in CI/CD for data pipelines.
3. Knowledge of Delta Lake, Unity Catalog, or related Databricks features.


**Additional Information:** 
1. **Work Mode:** 
 Onsite – Stockholm
2. **Type:** 
 Contract / Full-Time
3. **Visa Requirement:** 
 Candidates must have a
 **valid Swedish work permit or VISA** 
 .
4. *No visa sponsorship will be provided.*

title: Load Balancing Expert
description:
**Job ID:
 **30601****
**Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.**
 We are looking for Senior Load Balancing Engineer to ensure the maintenance and development of our existing complex load balancer infrastructure and to assist in new projects. This is an opportunity for you to get a key role in our Architecture and Design team and to cooperate with other engineering teams and key stakeholders to ensure a continuous further development, operation, and documentation of our infrastructure.
   

  

 Working with skilled, international teams in a fast-paced, agile environment, you’ll play a part in making us truly digital. We all have a role in building the best bank that serves our customers’ changing needs – through innovative solutions, collaboration and partnering with fintech’s.
   

  

 Are you ready to embark on a learning journey where we lead the way and push the limits in transforming the future of banking?
   

  

 You’ll join a multinational team of professionals that have fun at work. The role is based in Gdynia, Gdansk, Copenhagen, Helsinki or Stockholm.
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank; we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Meet the Network Architecture and Design team. We are a team of dedicated and highly skilled specialists that contributes to our customer success by designing and implementing secure and stable infrastructure solutions.
   

  

**Your future responsibilities:**
 As the Senior Load Balancing Engineer, you’ll play a valuable role as a key stakeholder in business projects across the whole organisation, you will work close to the platform owner and the architecture team. You will mainly be working with engineering and architectural tasks in the load balancer area but also helping in operations when required .
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Create and maintain architecture documentation
* Oversee the implementation of the designed architecture
* Capacity monitoring and planning
* Lifecycle planning of the platform and software
* Collaboration with the platform supplier
* Support in problem investigations
* Vulnerability monitoring and remediation planning
* Development and optimization of the Load Balancer platform
* Design and implement new solutions
* Cross-wide collaboration with technology area teams
* Support and advice Application and Business units in utilization of Load Balancer platform


**Who You Are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**You have as well knowledge/skills within:**
* SSL/TLS and secure certificates
* Network principals (minimum CCNA or equivalent). IP Subnets, NAT, routing and VLANs.
* Fundamentals of firewalls and multi-layer DMZ environments.
* Global Server Load Balancing, DNS and Zone Delegation
* WAF knowledge and experience
* TCP and UDP flow troubleshoo ting
* HTTP traffic analysis


**Your background and skills include:**
* You have several years’ experience within Citrix NetScaler ADC engineering and operations equivalent other vendor i.e. F5, preferably from a large and international company.
* You understand that operational stability is the highest priority, and you have a willingness to give an extra hand in cooperation with operations of our systems.
* Furthermore, you have capabilities in supporting the specifications of business requirements - solution design and development to implementation in our test environments .
* As a person, you are proactive and visionary in your approach to work, and with your great knowledge and attitude, you are always prepared to solve many tasks during a busy and varied workday.
* Acquaintance with Nordea’s systems, products and processes will be a big advantage.


**Nice to have:**
* Work experience within big network environment and strict change control
* Shell scripting and Python skills
* Knowledge of cloud security principles and technologies


**What We Offer**
 People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growthin one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**

title: Product Marketing Manager – GTM specialist
description:
At ABAX, Product Marketing isn't just a function – it's a strategic imperative and a direct driver of our growth. We are making a significant investment in Product Marketing capacity because we recognize its pivotal function as the driving force behind getting our innovative products to market and ensuring their sustained success.
   

  

**You will be joining a team that acts as**
* A true enabler of sales and an accelerator of adoption.
* The voice of the customer, masterminding compelling messaging rooted in pain point resolution.
* A bridge-builder, fostering crucial collaboration between Product, Tech, Commercial, and Marketing teams.
* A catalyst in tech sales, ensuring our products cut through the digital noise and establish an authentic signal in the market.


 This is a unique opportunity to take our existing Go-To-Market GTM processes and make them your own. To help support our growth into Asset Tracking, new domains and AI, you will play a critical role in commercialising new product updates and domains to ensure that ABAX stands out with an authentic and expert-led voice.
   

  

****What You’ll Work On****
 As our Product Marketing Manager, you will be at the forefront of our product lifecycle, ensuring our innovations reach and resonate with our target markets. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Strategic GTM Leadership: Lead and execute comprehensive Go-to-Market (GTM) strategies for new products, features, and solution offerings, ensuring successful launches and market penetration together with the marketing team.
* Masterful Messaging & Positioning: Develop market-leading positioning and differentiated messaging that translates complex technical features into clear, compelling, and customer-centric value propositions across our product portfolio.
* Sales & Commercial Enablement: Create powerful sales enablement tools, impactful marketing content, and compelling collateral that equip our field sales and commercial teams for maximum effectiveness.
* Customer & Market Advocacy: Act as the voice of the market within ABAX, conducting in-depth primary and secondary research on customer insights, market trends, and competitor activities (including telematics, fleet management, and cloud providers) to inform product strategy and identify new opportunities. You'll understand and leverage competitor weaknesses.
* Cross-functional Collaboration: Facilitate effective communication, alignment, and evangelism across Product, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Leadership teams, bridging critical gaps to ensure shared understanding and success.
* Thought Leadership & Evangelism: Contribute to and execute expert-led thought leadership initiatives, evangelizing ABAX products to analysts, prospects, and customers through meetings, webinars, conferences, and trade shows.
* Performance Insight: Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to track product adoption and usage growth, evaluating the impact of PMM efforts on market performance and identifying areas for optimization.


**What We're Looking For**
* 5+ years of progressive Product Marketing experience, with at least 2 years focused on G2M for SaaS / B2B / telematics or Fleet Management / Asset Tracking market, and direct collaboration with field sales & marketing teams.
* Proven experience in a B2B SaaS or tech environment; exposure to telematics, IoT, or asset tracking industries is a significant advantage.
* A strategic, analytical thinker with a pragmatic mindset and a strong customer-centric approach.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple complex projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Exceptional communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts clearly and persuasively to diverse audiences.
* A natural collaborator who thrives in cross-functional team settings and can build strong relationships.
* You are well-organized, detail-oriented, and excellent at prioritizing tasks.
* You are a dedicated team player who values open, continuous feedback on performance.
* You are someone who expects to be challenged and is always looking for ways to work smarter.


**Practical Details**
**Start Date:** 
 As soon as possible
   

  

**Work Extent** 
 : Full-time
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Application Deadline:** 
 August 15th
   

  

**Background Check and Reference Verification**
 Successful employment is contingent upon ABAX receiving satisfactory references.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we perform a digital reference check through RefApp, an advanced online solution for managing this procedure.
   

  

 Please be aware that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 At ABAX, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. This commitment extends to ensuring that our recruitment practices and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us in strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.
   

  

**About ABAX**
 ABAX is a leading European telematics IoT platform offering connected mobility solutions for vehicle tracking, tool tracking, and equipment control. Our mission is to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less.
   

  

 With over 500,000 tracked assets and 40,000 customers, ABAX delivers reliable and powerful solutions for businesses relying on physical operations. Our advanced platform transforms customer needs into actionable insights and automated reporting, driving efficiency and operational excellence.
   

  

 We operate across Europe, with over 350 employees working from our facilities in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, and the UK. Our Head Office is in Larvik, Norway.

title: Erfaren IT-infrastrukturspecialist till globalt företag
description:
Till vår kund i centrala Stockholm söker vi en erfaren och engagerad IT-infrastrukturspecialist som vill arbeta med drift och förvaltning av en stabil och affärskritisk IT-miljö tillsammans med ett sammansvetsat infrastrukturteam. Här får du en nyckelroll där du arbetar brett med serverhantering, nätverk och säkerhet i en miljö som ständigt utvecklas.
 



  





 Tjänsten börjar som ett konsultuppdrag via Centric, och efter sex månader kommer anställningen att övergå direkt till kunden. Detta är en utmärkt möjlighet för dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra med din expertis i en internationell organisation med långsiktigt fokus på tillförlitlig IT-infrastruktur.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 • Hantering av virtuella maskiner (implementering, förvaltning och avveckling) i VMware- och Nutanix-miljö
 



 • Hantering av Windows servermiljön (onprem)
 



 • Felsökning och drift av Cisco LAN och trådlösa nätverk
 



 • Leda och delta i projekt
 



 • Hantering av brandväggsregler och ständigt förbättra säkerheten i våra miljöer
 



 • Självständigt och tillsammans med andra lokala och globala team vara drivande i att utveckla befintlig miljö och implementera nya system
 



 • Incidenthantering
 



 • Stötta verksamheten vid implementering och uppgradering av verksamhetssystem
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




*Krav:* 




 • Minst 4-6 års yrkeserfarenhet inom relevanta områden
 



 • Relevant högskole-/universitetsutbildning och CCNA eller motsvarande kunskap
 



 • Erfarenhet av drift och underhåll av nätverk, Windows serverar, Active Directory, GPO och VMware
 



 • Scripting kunskaper
 



 • Flytande i tal och skrift i både svenska och engelska
 



*Det är meriterande om du har gått kurser eller innehar certifikat från VMware, Nutanix, Microsoft, Cisco och ITIL.* 




  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



*Mer om oss* 




 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Global Google Distribution Lead
job_function: Consulting, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Software Development
description:
* *Excited to step into a newly created role where you’ll drive job creation and lay the foundation for Google distribution at Crayon, perfect for a builder who thrives on creating structure, building relationships, and launching new initiatives?*
* *Keen to join a supportive, friendly and result-driven team, that values collaboration and continuous learning?*
* *Looking to be part of a fast-growing global company that uses innovation and the power of technology to drive the greater good?*



  





**Practical Information:** 




 Location:
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 | Reports to:
 **Vice President, Channel & Cloud** 
 | Visa Requirements:
 **Valid working visa for Sweden** 
 | Language Requirements:
 **Professional level English and another European language** 
 written and verbal | Work Arrangement:
 **Hybrid** 




  





 As our new
 **Global Google Distribution Lead,** 
 you will be responsible for
 **finalizing Google’s onboarding as a global distributor, building the value proposition,** 
 and enabling regional teams
 **.** 
 The role includes
 **regular business and marketing reviews with Google,** 
 supporting events and customer meetings, and
 **driving partner recruitment, country activation, and gross profit growth.** 




  





**Key Responsibilities Will Include** 



* Managing the global relationship with Google Distribution, and working with marketing on execution of marketing plans
* Becoming the go-to person for Google within Crayon’s Channel teams, leading enablement on Google’s GTM strategy, value proposition, and programs
* Being the voice of our Google partners, participating in partner events, and supporting our teams in partner meetings
* Being on top of Google programs for resellers and distributors
* Providing feedback to improve the overall customer experience at Crayon, such as Cloud-iQ, billing, support, and onboarding



  





**Your Competencies** 



* 1-3 years of experience working with Google Cloud (GCP and GWS) at a partner company
* 3 years of channel experience



  





**About You** 



* You are a reliable team player who works well across global and cross-functional teams
* You have strong organizational skills and a structured approach to managing tasks
* You are self-motivated and able to work independently to drive results.



  





**What's on Offer?** 



* Flexible working time and hybrid working model
* Fitness contribution (Friskvårdsbidrag) 4K per year
* Private health insurance
* Exclusive discounts through our employee portal (Benify)
* Personal and professional development opportunities
* Team and company events



  





**Apply to join an award-winning company!** 




  





 At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.
 



 When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.
 



 If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.
 



  





**Why Crayon?** 




 We believe in the power of technology to drive the greater good. Crayon is a global, people-first, vendor-agnostic company headquartered in Oslo, with more than 4,000 colleagues in 46 countries. We deliver first-class solutions to support customers build their commercial and technical foundation for a successful and secure cloud-first, digital transformation journey.
 



  





**Our Culture & Values** 




 We consider ourselves to be one big community. Our core values of Integrity, Quality, Pace and Agility were written over 20 years ago based on our Nordic heritage and still hold true to our global environment.
 



 We are committed to fostering an equitable work environment where everyone can reach their full potential. Our inclusive culture celebrates and values individual differences, ensuring all voices are heard and respected.
 



  





**Our Big Ambitions:** 




 We have set big and bold ambitions for our ESG strategy revolving around championing diversity, transitioning towards a greener, net zero GHG emissions and becoming a leader in ESG Product development.

title: Finsktalande IT-supporttekniker
description:
Till ett uppdrag i Solna söker vi nu en social, driven IT-tekniker som kan både tala och skriva flytande finska och svenska. Då är det här rätt tjänst för dig!
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





 Uppdraget är på heltid och kommer att pågå tills vidare.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Detta uppdrag som IT-supporttekniker kräver att du kan både tala och skriva flytande finska och svenska. Du erbjuds ett varierande arbete som kräver engagemang och initiativtagande med hög ansvarskänsla. Tycker du om att arbeta med felsökning på både 1st och 2nd line nivå i bred miljö?  Hos kunden kommer du att främst att supportera användarna via telefon och mail, men det kan även ske fysiskt på plats på kontoret. Du hjälper användarna med IT-relaterade frågor som rör användarnas datorer, utrustning, telefon, skrivare och program varor.

 Meriterande:

 Som person är du utåtriktad och har lätt för att samarbeta med andra. Du sätter användare i fokus samt utför arbetet med noggrannhet och god service som en självklarhet. Du är även van vid att arbeta självständigt och är målinriktad.
 



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. title: Senior Data Engineering
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Data Infrastructure and Analytics, and IT System Data Services
description:
Skala upp din karriär inom Data Analytics!
 



 Har du en passion för datadrivna lösningar och en vilja att göra skillnad? Vi är ett innovativt konsultföretag inom Data Analytics som kombinerar ett team av erfarna experter och ett starkt europeiskt partnernätverk för att skapa mervärde för våra kunders befintliga och framtida lösningar inom Data Analytics.
 



 Vår filosofi bygger på att vara starkare tillsammans och vi är stolta över att erbjuda en miljö där det är tryggt att utmana sig själv och lära av misstag, det är lärande och utveckling som driver oss framåt.
 



  





**Varför Rebtech?** 



* Bli en del av ett erfaret team – Arbeta med några av branschens mest kompetenta experter inom Data Analytics. Hos oss står lärande och kunskapsutbyte i fokus.
* Kultur som prioriterar gemenskap – Hos oss råder en prestigelös atmosfär där laget alltid går före jaget.
* Förmåner utöver det vanliga – Marknadsmässig fast lön, bonus, möjlighet till delägarskap samt generös pensionsavsättning, friskvårdsbidrag och regelbundna teamaktiviteter gör att du både kan växa och trivas på jobbet.



  





**Data Engineer på Rebtech** 




 Som Data Engineer på rebtech har en central roll i att designa, bygga och underhålla kundernas dataplattformar och pipelines. Du vill arbeta brett och hantera hela leveranskedjan – från dataintegration till att skapa värdefulla insikter för kunderna. Rollen ger dig utrymme att vara innovativ och proaktiv i att möta kundernas specifika behov och utmaningar.
 



  





**Du besitter flera av följande egenskaper** 



* Har en problemlösande attityd med förmåga att arbeta självständigt
* Är lösningsorienterad, driven, vill lära och lära ut
* Har fyra eller fler års erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence och Data Warehousing
* Har programmeringskunskaper i ett eller flera språk (Python, Scala, Java eller liknande)
* Har erfarenhet av bygga ETL/ELT-pipelines
* Har erfarenhet Azure och MS FAbric
* Van att arbeta med DevOps: GIT, CI/CD
* Har erfarenhet av containerteknologier och IaC (Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform eller liknande )
* Arbetat med moderna verktyg som Databricks, DBT, Power BI och Airflow
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Relevant universitetsexamen



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 



* Analytisk och problemlösningsorienterad.
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Nyfikenhet och vilja att lära sig nya teknologier.
* God kommunikationsförmåga i både tal och skrift.



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* Möjlighet att arbeta med cutting-edge teknologi och spännande projekt.
* En arbetsmiljö som främjar kreativitet och innovation.
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter.
* Flexibla arbetsvillkor och bra arbetslivsbalans.



  





**Ansökningsprocess** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Aliby - The Pink Company. Då intervjuer och urval sker löpande ber vi dig att inte vänta med din ansökan. Vid intresse vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Thandi Schüler på thandi.schuler@aliby.se 0730-742503
 







 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Data & Evaluation Engineer – Video Analytics, Lund
description:
Job Title
Data & Evaluation Engineer – Video Analytics, Lund
Job Description*At Axis Communications, we don’t just create cameras — we create world-leading intelligent systems that understand what they see to keep people safe. Our* *advanced analytics* *analyses video streams in real time, powering surveillance and safety applications worldwide. We are now looking for a hands-on, senior computer vision Data & Evaluation Engineer to join our Analytics team in Lund, Sweden. Is that you?*
Your future team
One of Axis greatest assets is our culture with a strong focus on collaboration. We know that good ideas can come anytime and anywhere and therefore we encourage everyone to contribute and be innovative. If you are a person who likes to make a difference, you will feel right at home with us! We want you to enjoy working with us and we believe team spirit, collaboration, learning, equal opportunities for all and having fun are central parts in this.
What You'll Do
This opportunity is all about understanding the functionality and accuracy of our analytics use case solutions. To ensure our solutions perform at their best you will be responsible for evaluating AI model and use case accuracy performance on real-world scenario data set coverage and key metrics. You will craft, curate and maintain the essential video evaluation datasets and metrics for scene and use case coverage. For this, you will also, define, update, and implement annotation guidelines that are clear, consistent, and reflect diverse real-world conditions to ensure consistent, reliable ground truth for evaluation. We want you to take charge of annotation quality control, working hands-on with tools like CVAT and collaborating with annotators.
This isn’t a role where you hand down specs and walk away. This is about being in the engine room — building the data sets from the ground up, ensuring they are relevant, structured, accurate, and reflective of the real world in all its complexity. Think edge cases, shifting light, moving shadows... Advocate for dataset completeness and scenario coverage, ensuring AI models, algorithms and use cases are tested against real-world edge cases and safety-critical events. You will evaluate and analyze AI model outputs, algorithms and use case accuracy performance using your curated datasets and key metrics - accuracy, precision, recall, confusion matrix, false positive/negative rates, product metrics etc - to uncover strengths and opportunities. You won’t be training AI models from scratch but will work closely with machine learning engineers and algorithm developers to translate evaluation insights into validated and improved use case performance. As such you will contribute to data-driven AI model, algorithm and use case debugging, identifying whether errors stem from data gaps or algorithm limitations.
Who are you?
You believe that great analytics solutions depend on appropriate data validation and evaluation - and that the details matter. You bring deep experience as data scientist or similar, designing and working with video analytics datasets, preferably in safety-critical or surveillance contexts. You are skilled in accuracy performance evaluation of analytics use cases and have practical knowledge of evaluation metrics and best practices for AI model, algorithm and use case testing and validation.
You are detail-oriented and hands-on, driven to translate evaluation data into actionable insights. You are comfortable diving into annotations both in terms of crafting guidelines and working with tools e.g. CVAT or developing internally crafted tools if that better suits the needs at hand. You are software savvy and can pick up a language like Python or dashboard tool without issue. You thrive in collaborative environments and know the power of bridging data, evaluation, and algorithm development.
Most importantly, you want to work somewhere that values your expertise and encourages inclusivity, mentorship, and continuous learning. In our team you will not only be an exceptional data and evaluation engineer but also a mentor and coach who can inspire and grow our team.
What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
If you’re ready to apply your skills in video data and evaluation of analytics solutions systems and work with a diverse, innovative team, we want to hear from you.
Apply today or get in touch with me, Julia.nilsson@axis.com, for an informal conversation. Let’s build a safer, smarter world - together.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-09-02*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Analytics Engineer - Scene Understanding, Lund
description:
Job Title
Analytics Engineer - Scene Understanding, Lund
Job Description*Are you passionate about transforming complex sensor data into a clear, actionable understanding of the world? Do you thrive on building high-quality analytics scene intelligence that power real-world safety and surveillance applications? If so, we want you to join our Analytics team in Lund!*
Your future team
At Axis Analytics Solutions we’re on a mission to create the most reliable, intelligent scene understanding analytics platform - one that unifies multi-sensory input and system knowledge into a single, dynamic data model. This data model is the backbone of our business logic and metadata offerings that makes surveillance safer, smarter, and more effective for security, safety, operational efficiency, and business intelligence. One of Axis greatest assets is our culture with a strong focus on collaboration. We know that good ideas can come anytime and anywhere and therefore we encourage everyone to contribute and be innovative. If you are a person who likes to make a difference, you will feel right at home with us! You’ll be at the heart of a groundbreaking product that directly impacts safety and security in real environments. Your work will shape how data becomes actionable insights, protecting people and assets worldwide. We want you to enjoy working with us and we believe team spirit, collaboration, learning, equal opportunities for all and having fun are central parts in this.
What You'll Do
Our team contributes to building the analytics data product that represents the world through fused sensor inputs and rich system knowledge, delivering a trusted, real-time scene understanding engine. As a member of our team, you will be part of architecting and developing the data model that integrates multi-sensor data and incorporates logic rules, physical constraints, and dynamic behavior into one unified model for meaningful, context-aware representations. Your focus will be on delivering the critical middle layer that bridges machine learning models and algorithm outputs with business logic for surveillance and safety applications. Your contribution ensures practical, product-driven fusion solutions that enhance scene understanding and interpretation and support downstream analytics business logic and metadata applications.
Every day you will collaborate closely with algorithm developers, product managers, and other colleagues to ensure the analytics data product meets real-world use case needs and drives impactful business outcomes. You will also roll up your sleeves yourself and together with your team validate use case accuracy performance and optimize your solutions as appropriate. You’ll mentor and inspire your peers, foster a culture of innovation, and collaborate across teams to ensure our solutions are not just theoretically elegant but product-ready and impactful.
Who are you?
We believe you are a person who is trustworthy and respected in your professional role. We expect you thrive when collaborating with your team and are an experienced, pragmatic and proactive problem solver who balances cutting-edge technology with practical product delivery. We hope you are curious and passionate about producing high quality, robust and reusable multi-sensor data models and someone who has built software model products from design to validation and deployment. Continuous improvement is important to you and it’s natural for you to share your knowledge so that we learn alongside you and you with us.
More concretely, we would like you to bring* Vast experienced with scene understanding, semantic data modelling and sensor fusion, especially with video, and are comfortable applying logic rules, physical constraints, and dynamic system knowledge to create meaningful data representations.
* Passion about scene understanding and modelling real-world environments from sensor data to enable product-driven innovations.
* Background in video analytics, computer vision, or related domains with strong algorithm development skills, including multi-sensor integration, real-time processing and analytics accuracy performance evaluation.
* Excellent collaboration and communication ability with fluency in English and Swedish is a bonus.
* Software savvy e.g. Python and C++ and knowledgeable on how to develop software for products.
* Experience mentoring and coaching your team with a commitment to fostering inclusive, collaborative environments where diverse perspectives thrive for innovation and product-focused development.


What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*.
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Ready to turn complex sensor data into a product people rely on every day? Join us on our mission to create scene understanding systems that do more than detect - that interpret and reason, integrating physical rules and dynamics to deliver actionable insights for safety and business applications* helping build safer communities around the world.

Apply today or get in touch with me, Julia.nilsson@axis.com, for an informal conversation. Let’s build the future of scene understanding—together.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-09-02*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Design for Production Engineer, Lund
description:
Job Title
Design for Production Engineer, Lund
Job Description*Do you thrive, working in different projects? And are you good at collaborating and communicating within cross-functional teams? We are now looking for a Design for Production Engineer to join our Industrialization Production and Test – Fixed Dome team in Lund, do not hesitate to apply! Both entry level and experienced applicants are encouraged to apply.*
Who is your future team?
You will be a part of a diverse team of Test engineers and Design for Production engineers cooperating to bring Axis products to market. The role gives a broad range of creative interfaces and an opportunity to cooperate with and learn from them i.e., Mechanics, Electronics Production, Software, Supply Chain and Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS’s).  

What you’ll do here as Design for Production Engineer?
As a Design for Production Engineer, you will ensure that our latest innovations are producible at high volumes by playing a key role in the development of both assembly-friendly products and time efficient, high yielding production processes. Producing high-caliber security products that our customers can depend on ensures that Axis continues to fulfill promises of safer and smarter communities across the globe. Our work is largely project based. Each product follows a five-phase development process that typically runs from one to two years. Within each project, you will:* Initiate workshops and discussions centered around `design for assembly`
* Define the product’s assembly process and co-create its full production process with one of our manufacturing partners (located in North America, Asia, or Europe)
* Set design requirements for complex assembly and test fixtures, verify that they are manufactured to this specification, and secure their timely delivery to one of our manufacturing partners
* Visit the product’s manufacturing site during at least one pre-production build to verify the production process (up to 30 days of travel per year is expected)

  

This role depends heavily on effective collaboration and communication within cross-functional teams. We often refer to ourselves as the ‘spider-in-the-web’ since we influence many different areas within our projects and interact with so many stakeholders.  

Who are we looking for/Who are you?
Are you curious? Analytical? Organized? Do you enjoy facing new challenges and taking the initiative to find solutions? Are you passionate about aligning R&D innovations with production realities? If so, please apply. We are interested in learning about why you are a perfect fit for our team and sharing more about what Axis has to offer you.  

Preferred skills and qualifications:* Degree in mechanical or industrial engineering
* Demonstrated interest in production
* Proficient English

  

Advantageous skills and qualifications:* Experience working with 3D CAD programs and PDM systems
* Knowledge of mechatronic systems
* Experience within SMT production, automation, or optics
* International working experience


What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact.
Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide.
As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance. *Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*  

Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:
Life at Axis blog
Engineering at Axis blog
Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!
In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Helena.Wedin@axis.com
